titleStmt.title: James H. Garrard to J. F. Zimmerman
CWG4717

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
JAMES H. GARRARD, TREASURER.
TREASURY OFFICE,
Frankfort, Kentucky,
March 14th, 1864.
To J F Zimmerman, Esq:
Sir:
Some days ago the balance due from you as clerk was paid into the Treasury, It included the damages Say $43 27/100.
This is I believe is the first case that damages have been collected and paid into the Treasury.
Gov. Bramlitte has the power to remit the damages & always where the prinicpal, Interest and cost is paid, he has released the party from payment of damages.

Remit the damages
$43.27
Tho E Bramlette

Franklin Cir Ct
vs
J. F. Zimmerman
Clk Boyle Co Ct
Damages
Remitted
3th Apl/64
